openpibo.modules.oled.pure_spi module¶

Adafruit_PureIO.spi¶

Pure python (i.e. no native extensions) access to Linux IO SPI interface that is similar to the SpiDev API. * Author(s): Melissa LeBlanc-Williams Implementation Notes ——————– Software and Dependencies: * Linux and Python 3.5 or Higher

class openpibo.modules.oled.pure_spi.SPI(device, max_speed_hz=None, bits_per_word=None, phase=None, polarity=None, cs_high=None, lsb_first=None, three_wire=None, loop=None, no_cs=None, ready=None)¶

Bases: object

This class is similar to SpiDev, but instead of opening and closing for each call, it is set up on initialization making it fast.

property bits_per_word¶

Number of bits per word of SPI transfer. A value of 0 is equivalent to 8 bits per word

property cs_high¶

SPI chip select active level

property loop¶

SPI loopback mode

property lsb_first¶

Bit order of SPI word transfers

property max_speed_hz¶

Maximum SPI transfer speed in Hz. Note that the controller cannot necessarily assign the requested speed.

property mode¶

Mode that SPI is currently running in

property no_cs¶

No chipselect. Single device on bus.

property phase¶

SPI clock phase bit

property polarity¶

SPI polarity bit

readbytes(length, max_speed_hz=0, bits_per_word=0, delay=0)¶

Perform half-duplex SPI read as a binary string

property ready¶

Slave pulls low to pause

property three_wire¶

SPI 3-wire mode

transfer(data, max_speed_hz=0, bits_per_word=0, delay=0)¶

Perform full-duplex SPI transfer

writebytes(data, max_speed_hz=0, bits_per_word=0, delay=0)¶

Perform half-duplex SPI write.
